news_header: Justin Hotard will become Nokia's new CEO in April, succeeding Pekka Lundmark, who is stepping down after leading the company since 2020.
news_original_title: Nokia kertoo, miksi toimitus­johtaja vaihtuu – uusi johtaja Justin Hotard vauhdittaa muutosta tekoälyaikaan
news_text: Justin Hotard, currently heading Intel's data center and AI business, will take over as CEO of Nokia from April, succeeding Pekka Lundmark. Hotard brings over 25 years of experience in technology leadership and innovation, which is crucial for Nokia's future growth in AI and data centers. Lundmark praised Nokia's advancements under his leadership, especially in 5G and network infrastructure. He expressed a desire to transition to a different role after 23 years of running listed companies. The change in leadership is seen as a necessary step for Nokia to adapt to market changes and continue its growth.
